title: 16 Indians Fighting In Russian Army 'Missing', 12 Killed So Far In Ukraine War: MEA - News18
summary:
16 Indians Missing, 12 Reported Dead in Ukraine Conflict: MEA Updates

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: News18

At least 16 Indian nationals deployed by the Russian Army in Ukraine are currently missing, with 12 confirmed dead, as reported by the Ministry of External Affairs.

  • There are 126 Indian nationals known to have served in the Russian Army.
  • 96 of these have returned to India, with 18 still in service.
  • 16 are categorized as missing by Russian authorities, while 12 have died in the conflict.
“As of today, there have been 126 cases (of Indian nationals serving in the Russian Army). Of these 126 cases, 96 people have returned to India and have been discharged from the Russian Armed Forces.” - MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal

The Indian embassy is working with Russian authorities to facilitate the repatriation of the deceased's remains and to assist those who are still serving.
newTitle: 16 Indians Missing, 12 Reported Dead in Ukraine Conflict: MEA Updates

title: After flak, JD(U) caution, Shehzad Poonawala says sorry: ‘I apologise wholeheartedly to my Purvanchali brothers and sisters’ - The Indian Express
REET 2025 Admit Card To be Released Soon, Check Level 1 & 2 Paper Pattern and Other Exam Details - Pasteur Institute of India
summary:
REET 2025 Admit Card To be Released Soon, Check Level 1 & 2 Paper Pattern and Other Exam Details

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education will soon conduct the Rajasthan Eligibility Examination for Teachers (REET) to evaluate candidates who aspire to teach in Rajasthan from Classes 1 to 8. The exam is scheduled for February 27, 2025, and admit cards will be available from February 19, 2025.

  • The REET 2025 exam will be held in offline mode.
  • Candidates must download the admit card as it is essential for entering the exam venue.
  • The Level 1 exam is from 10:00 AM to 12:30 PM and the Level 2 exam from 3:00 PM to 5:30 PM on the exam day.
  • Subjects for Level 1 and Level 2 are outlined, with each paper designed as multiple-choice questions without negative marking.
  • It is crucial for candidates to verify their admit card details and address any discrepancies immediately.
The admit card is a mandatory document containing crucial information such as name, roll number, exam date, and guidelines for exam day.

The REET exam is a vital step for aspiring teachers in Rajasthan, ensuring that only qualified individuals are able to gain teaching positions.
newTitle: REET 2025 Admit Card Release and Exam Details

title: Delhi assembly elections: BJP's manifesto promises free cylinder on Holi & Diwali; Rs 21,000 to pregnant - The Times of India
summary:
Delhi Assembly Elections: BJP Promises Free Gas Cylinders and Financial Support for Pregnant Women

Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

An overview of the BJP's election manifesto for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections, highlighting key promises aimed at supporting families and women in particular.

  • Free gas cylinders for Holi and Diwali.
  • Financial support of Rs 21,000 for pregnant women.
  • Focus on welfare schemes to gain voter support.
“We are committed to the welfare of all families in Delhi,” a party spokesperson stated.

This manifesto reflects a strategic approach by the BJP to appeal to voters through social welfare promises in the run-up to the elections.
newTitle: Delhi Assembly Elections: BJP Promises Free Gas Cylinders and Financial Support for Pregnant Women

title: 8th Pay Commission: Minimum Basic Salary Of Central Govt Employees Likely To Rise Above Rs 40,000 - News18
summary:
8th Pay Commission: Minimum Basic Salary Of Central Govt Employees Likely To Rise Above Rs 40,000

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: News18

The Union Cabinet has approved the 8th Pay Commission, with the minimum basic salary of central government employees expected to exceed ₹40,000 per month from January 1, 2026.

  • The 8th Pay Commission aims to ensure competitive salaries alongside allowances and performance pay.
  • A fitment factor between 2.6 and 2.85 may lead to salary increases of 25-30%.
  • The current minimum salary under the 7th Pay Commission is ₹18,000 per month, which may rise to around ₹36,020 with allowances.
  • The recommendations of the 8th Pay Commission are set to be implemented in early 2026.
  • Periodic pay revisions are crucial to address inflation and maintain equitable remuneration.
“The 8th Pay Commission is pivotal in addressing evolving economic realities…” - Neeti Sharma, CEO of TeamLease Digital

This upcoming pay commission could significantly impact government employees' livelihoods, enhancing financial empowerment and boosting consumption in the economy.
newTitle: 8th Pay Commission: Minimum Basic Salary Of Central Govt Employees Likely To Rise Above Rs 40,000

Karnataka High Court Stays Trial Against Congress Leader Rahul Gandhi In Defamation Case Lodged By State... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Karnataka High Court Stays Trial Against Rahul Gandhi in Defamation Case

Publication Date: January 17 | Source: Live Law

The Karnataka High Court has issued an interim stay on the trial proceedings against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in a criminal defamation case filed by the State BJP. The court will hear the case further on February 20.

  • The Karnataka High Court stayed the trial court proceedings against Rahul Gandhi.
  • The case pertains to defamation claims by the BJP over Congress's “Corruption Rate card” advertisements.
  • The BJP accused Gandhi of maligning their reputation before elections.
  • The court has issued an emergent notice to the respondent, returnable by February 20.
  • Gandhi was previously granted bail in a related case in June last year.
“Emergent notice to the respondent returnable by February 20. By way of interim order, there shall be a stay of further proceedings.”

This stay allows Rahul Gandhi temporary relief in a politically charged defamation case ahead of upcoming elections.
newTitle: Karnataka High Court Stays Trial Against Rahul Gandhi in Defamation Case

title: BJP releases first part of manifesto for Delhi election: Key promises - Moneycontrol
summary:
BJP Releases First Part of Delhi Election Manifesto, Promises Rs 2,500 a Month to Women and More

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The BJP has released the first part of its Sankalp Patra (manifesto) for the upcoming Delhi elections, including a promise to provide financial support to women.

  • Women will receive Rs 2,500 under the Mahila Samman Nidhi scheme.
  • The manifesto is part of a roadmap for a "Viksit Delhi" (Developed Delhi).
  • BJP President JP Nadda highlighted the party's previous successes in fulfilling election promises.
“We made 500 promises in 2014, we delivered 499. In 2019, we made 235, we completed 225. The rest were also on the stage of implementation,” said Nadda.

The BJP aims to make Delhi corruption-free and considers this manifesto as the foundation for a developed Delhi.
newTitle: BJP Releases Delhi Election Manifesto Promising Financial Support for Women

title: At Maha Kumbh, 7-Foot Tall 'Muscular Baba' From Russia Steals The Spotlight - NDTV
summary:
Russian 'Muscular Baba' Captivates at Maha Kumbh Festival

Date: Not specified
Source: Not specified

The Maha Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj is drawing millions globally, with a notable figure being Atma Prem Giri Maharaj, a 7-foot tall 'muscular baba' from Russia who promotes Hinduism passionately.

  • Atma Prem Giri Maharaj, dressed in saffron robes, is being compared to Lord Parshuram.
  • He has dedicated his life to Hinduism, leaving behind a teaching career 30 years ago.
  • A photo of him went viral on Instagram, sparking admiration among users.
  • Other unique figures include 'IIT Baba', a former aerospace engineer, and 'Kabootar Wale Baba', who has a pigeon as a pet.
'Har Har Mahadev' – Comments on the viral photo of Atma Prem Giri Maharaj.

The presence of these individuals at the Maha Kumbh adds to the rich tapestry of spirituality and devotion celebrated at this iconic gathering.
newTitle: Russian 'Muscular Baba' Captivates at Maha Kumbh Festival

title: Kolkata Court To Deliver Verdict On RG Kar Rape-Murder Case On January 18 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Kolkata Court to Announce Verdict in RG Kar Rape-Murder Case on January 18

Publication Date: January 17, 2024

Source: LiveLaw

A sessions court in Kolkata's Sealdah area is set to deliver its verdict on the RG Kar rape and murder case involving a trainee doctor who was tragically assaulted and killed after her night shift. The incident triggered nationwide protests and legal actions, leading to a transfer of the case to the CBI and involvement of the Supreme Court.

  • The incident occurred in August 2024, sparking public outrage and protests throughout India.
  • The case was transferred to the CBI after investigations by the West Bengal CID faced criticism.
  • The Supreme Court intervened to frame workplace safety guidelines for doctors and monitor the investigation.
  • Protests demanded justice and accountability for the individuals involved in the cover-up.
  • Only one accused, Sanjoy Roy, has a chargesheet filed against him; others were granted bail due to delays in the investigation.
  • The verdict on January 18 will determine the legal standing of the charges against Roy.
“The victim's family and supporters are eagerly awaiting justice.”

This case has highlighted significant issues regarding safety in workplaces for healthcare professionals, and the verdict is highly anticipated within the community.
newTitle: Kolkata Court to Announce Verdict in RG Kar Rape-Murder Case on January 18

title: What to expect from the new US consulate in Bengaluru - The Indian Express
summary:
What to expect from the new US consulate in Bengaluru

Publication Date: January 17, 2024

Source: Indian Express

The new US consulate in Bengaluru aims to enhance economic and political relations between the US and Karnataka, becoming the fifth US consulate in India.

  • The consulate will strengthen trade relations and support investment ecosystems.
  • It is not expected to process visa applications immediately upon opening.
  • The formal announcement for the consulate's establishment was made during PM Narendra Modi's visit to the US in June 2023.
  • Bengaluru is significant due to its role as India's IT hub, with a large number of US-based multinational companies.
  • The consulate will initially focus on economic and political ties before starting visa services.
“The consulate in Bengaluru will hopefully open in January 2025.” - Eric Garcetti, outgoing US Ambassador to India

The establishment of this consulate is anticipated to significantly benefit US businesses and ease the visa process for residents in southern Karnataka.
newTitle: What to expect from the new US consulate in Bengaluru

title: Fact Check: 'IITian Baba' Or Ex-Brahmos Engineer Convicted For Espionage? Details Inside - NDTV
summary:
Fact Check: 'IITian Baba' Or Ex-Brahmos Engineer Convicted For Espionage? Details Inside

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 Source: PTI, republished by NDTV

The article investigates claims circulating on social media that a man identified as Nishant Agarwal, a former BrahMos Aerospace engineer, was sentenced to life imprisonment for spying for Pakistan. The investigation finds that the man in the photo is actually Abhey Singh, known as 'IITian Baba', who is not connected to the espionage case.

  • The claim surfaced after an interview with Abhey Singh at the Maha Kumbh.
  • Singh is a self-styled holy man and a graduate of IIT Bombay.
  • Nishant Agarwal was sentenced to life imprisonment in June 2024 for espionage.
  • The PTI Fact Check Desk confirmed the misidentification through various sources and image analysis.
“The photo was shared on social media with false claims,” - PTI Fact Check.

The investigation clarified that Abhey Singh is not involved in espionage and was wrongly identified as Nishant Agarwal.
newTitle: Fact Check: Misidentification of 'IITian Baba' as Ex-BrahMos Engineer Convicted for Espionage

title: ‘Ready to wait for five years, snatch justice if needed’: Father of RG Kar victim ahead of court verdict - The Indian Express
summary:
‘Ready to wait for five years, snatch justice if needed’: Father of RG Kar victim ahead of court verdict

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: The Indian Express

The verdict in the R G Kar rape and murder case is anticipated soon, with the victim's father expressing readiness to wait for justice and vowing not to beg but to fight for it. He is focused on the accountability of the prime accused and has concerns regarding the investigation's thoroughness.

  • The victim's father is prepared to wait for five years for justice.
  • He emphasized that the prime accused, Sanjoy Roy, will face appropriate punishment as determined by the court.
  • Concerns have been raised about the investigation, claiming it was inadequate after the initial days.
  • A 31-year-old junior doctor was raped and murdered in August last year, sparking public outrage.
  • Junior doctors and politicians are calling for maximum punishment for Roy and for the identification of all involved parties.
  • There are allegations of tampering with evidence and mishandling of the investigation.
“He will be punished, and whatever the court feels, that punishment will be given to him.” - Father of the victim

This case highlights significant concerns about the judicial process and the effectiveness of ongoing investigations. The victim's family and the public await a resolution that delivers justice and addresses the broader implications of the crime.
newTitle: Father of RG Kar victim determined to seek justice ahead of court verdict

title: Union Budget 2025: Govt may introduce personal income tax breaks, says report - Moneycontrol
summary:
Union Budget 2025: Govt may introduce personal income tax breaks, says report

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: CNBC-TV18

The Centre is considering introducing personal income-tax breaks to boost consumption.

  • The standard deduction limit may be increased from Rs 75,000 a year.
  • Expansion of the income range for the 20% tax rate from Rs 12–15 lakh to Rs 12–20 lakh is being considered.
  • This move could provide relief to taxpayers in the Rs 15–20 lakh bracket.
Moneycontrol couldn't verify the report independently.

This potential tax reform is aimed at making the new tax regime more attractive to taxpayers.
newTitle: Union Budget 2025: Govt may introduce personal income tax breaks, says report

title: Supreme Court Stays HC Order Requiring Delhi Govt To Sign MoU With Centre On Implementation Of PM-ABHIM... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Halts Delhi HC Order on PM-ABHIM MoU

Publication Date: Today

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court today stayed the Delhi High Court order requiring the Delhi government to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Centre for the implementation of the PM-Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission (PM-ABHIM) in Delhi.

  • The Supreme Court's bench comprised Justices BR Gavai and AG Masih.
  • The Delhi government challenged the High Court's order, citing concerns over the scope of the Centre's powers in health matters.
  • Delhi government's counsel argued that while the Centre could cover 60% of capital expenditure, it would not fund running costs.
  • The High Court's order arose from a public interest litigation (PIL) about ICU beds and ventilator availability.
  • Previously, the High Court expressed concerns about insufficient medical infrastructure in Delhi.
“Non-implementation of the PM-ABHIM Scheme in Delhi, when 33 States/UTs have already implemented the same, would not be justified.”

In conclusion, the Supreme Court's stay on the High Court's directive highlights ongoing tensions between local and federal health authorities regarding the implementation of critical health infrastructure projects.
newTitle: Supreme Court Halts Delhi HC Order on PM-ABHIM MoU

title: ‘Garbhavigyan’ event at IIT-Bombay, students cry pseudoscience - The Times of India
Supreme Court Pauses High Court Order Over Ayushman Bharat Scheme In Delhi - NDTV
summary:
Supreme Court Pauses High Court Order Over Ayushman Bharat Scheme In Delhi

Publication Date: Not specified; Source: Not specified

The Supreme Court has temporarily halted a Delhi High Court ruling that mandated the Delhi government to execute a Memorandum of Understanding to facilitate the implementation of the Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission (PM-ABHIM) scheme.

  • The Supreme Court issued notices to the central government, AIIMS, and the Municipal Corporation of Delhi in response to a petition from the Delhi government against the High Court ruling.
  • Last month, the Delhi High Court ordered the MoU to be signed by January 5.
  • The AAP government argues against the scheme, claiming that Delhi has better benefits under its own health schemes.
  • This issue could escalate political tensions between the BJP and AAP ahead of crucial government elections in the city.
  • The Delhi government's counsel contends that signing the MoU would overstep the central government’s authority regarding health policy.
The High Court stated, “Not implementing the ABHIM Scheme in Delhi would not be justified since 33 States and UTs have already implemented it.”

This development highlights ongoing political friction regarding health policy and governance between the central and Delhi state authorities.
newTitle: Supreme Court Pauses Implementation of Ayushman Bharat Scheme in Delhi

title: ‘Need 50% Cut In Metro Fares For Students’: Arvind Kejriwal To PM Modi Ahead Of Delhi Polls - News18
summary:
Kejriwal Demands 50% Metro Fare Cut for Students Ahead of Delhi Elections

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 Source: News18

Arvind Kejriwal has proposed a 50% metro fare concession for students in a letter to Prime Minister Modi, aiming to ease the financial burden on students as Delhi approaches assembly elections.

  • Kejriwal's proposal aimed at benefiting students commuting via Delhi Metro.
  • He requests the central and state governments to share the costs of the concession.
  • The AAP plans to make bus rides free for students in the future.
  • This proposal comes just days before the upcoming assembly elections in Delhi on February 5.

“To alleviate the financial burden on students, I propose offering a 50% concession on metro fares for students.”

This suggestion emphasizes the importance of affordable transportation for education and highlights the AAP's ongoing commitment to addressing student needs ahead of the polls.
newTitle: Kejriwal Demands 50% Metro Fare Cut for Students Ahead of Delhi Elections

title: 'We'll Resolve If Not Resolved By Next Week' : Supreme Court On Deadlock Over Tamil Nadu University VC... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
Former Kerala High Court judge loses ₹90 lakh to cyber scam - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Former Kerala High Court Judge Falls Victim to ₹90 Lakh Cyber Scam

Published on: 17 Jan 2025, 6:28 am

Former Kerala High Court judge Justice M Sasidharan Nambiar has reportedly lost ₹90 lakh to a cyber scam involving a fraudulent share trading app.

  • Justice Nambiar was scammed through a WhatsApp group named Aditya Birla Equity Learning Group.
  • He was promised exorbitant returns of 850% on his investments.
  • The money transfer occurred between December 4 and December 30, 2024.
  • Two suspects, Ayana Joseph and Varsha Singh, have been named in the FIR.
  • The FIR includes charges related to criminal breach of trust and cheating.
“He transferred the ₹90 lakhs in less than a month before he learned it was a scam.”

This incident highlights the vulnerability of individuals, even those in high positions, to sophisticated cyber scams.
newTitle: Former Kerala High Court Judge Falls Victim to ₹90 Lakh Cyber Scam

title: US Consulate inaugurated in Bengaluru, visa services to start soon, says Eric Garcetti - Hindustan Times
summary:
US Consulate inaugurated in Bengaluru, visa services to start soon, says Eric Garcetti

Date: January 17, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The United States has officially inaugurated its consulate in Bengaluru with plans to start visa services soon. This was marked by a ceremony led by External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and US Ambassador Eric Garcetti.

  • The consulate will initially operate from a temporary location at the JW Marriott Hotel.
  • Jaishankar emphasized the importance of having a permanent US diplomatic presence in Bengaluru.
  • Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar called the opening a significant event.
  • BJP MP Tejasvi Surya noted the consulate's importance for local residents.
  • Garcetti confirmed that visa services will commence in the future.
“It has been something long in waiting...” - S Jaishankar

The establishment of the consulate underscores Bengaluru's global importance, with a commitment from the US to enhance its diplomatic presence in India.
newTitle: US Consulate Inaugurated in Bengaluru, Visa Services Coming Soon

title: Arvind Kejriwal writes to PM Narendra Modi, proposes 50% concession for students in Delhi Metro, free bus - The Times of India
summary:
Kejriwal Proposes Concessions for Students in Delhi Metro and Free Bus Rides

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Times of India

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has reached out to Prime Minister Narendra Modi with a proposal to provide 50% concession for students using the Delhi Metro and to offer free bus rides.

  • This initiative aims to ease the financial burden on students in Delhi.
  • Kejriwal emphasizes the need for government support in public transportation.
  • The proposal is part of a broader strategy to enhance accessibility for students in the capital.
“Students should not face financial hurdles in their pursuit of education,” Kejriwal stated.

This proposal reflects the government's commitment to supporting the younger population and promoting education in Delhi.
newTitle: Kejriwal Proposes Concessions for Students in Delhi Metro and Free Bus Rides

title: US consulate opens in Bengaluru, visa services to begin later - Moneycontrol
UAPA case: Supreme Court denies bail to former PFI chairman Abubacker - The Hindu
summary:
Supreme Court Denies Bail to Former PFI Chairman Abubacker

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court has rejected a plea for interim bail on medical grounds from E. Abubacker, former chairman of the Popular Front of India (PFI), who is facing charges under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act.

  • The Supreme Court denied bail to E. Abubacker, citing ongoing legal challenges and health concerns.
  • Abubacker has been in custody since September 22, 2022, following a crackdown by the National Investigation Agency (NIA).
  • The court was presented with medical reports detailing Abubacker's health issues, including Parkinson's disease and cancer.
  • There was resistance to the idea of house arrest as an alternative to bail, with officials stating it sets a concerning precedent.
  • Abubacker was alleged to be connected to SIMI, a banned organization.
“The PFI had conspired and covertly aimed to establish Sharia law in India by overthrowing the democratic system of government.”

In conclusion, the Supreme Court's ruling reflects ongoing legal scrutiny concerning associations with domestic and anti-terror organizations and highlights the complex legal challenges faced by individuals under such charges.
newTitle: Supreme Court Denies Bail to Former PFI Chairman Abubacker

title: 'Something Wrong In ED' : ASG SV Raju Disowns ED's Affidavit, Says It's Filed Without Verification;... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
ASG SV Raju Questions ED's Affidavit in Supreme Court Hearing

Date: January 17, 2024 | Source: LiveLaw

Additional Solicitor General SV Raju raised concerns about the integrity of a counter-affidavit submitted by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) regarding a bail petition in a significant money laundering case linked to the Chhattisgarh liquor scam.

  • The ASG described the counter-affidavit as 'half-baked' and filed without proper vetting.
  • Raju suspects 'something fishy' about how the affidavit was handled by the ED.
  • Justice Oka questioned how the Advocate on Record could submit the affidavit without proper instructions.
  • The ASG mentioned he would be conducting an internal inquiry into the ED's actions.
  • Despite the issues raised, the judge noted the necessity to proceed with the case, scheduling a hearing for February 5.
“There is something fishy in the filing of the affidavit that is what I found yesterday.” - ASG SV Raju

The court noted discrepancies in the custody period of the accused and expressed its concerns regarding the ED's methods, indicating a need for greater scrutiny and accountability within the agency.
newTitle: ASG SV Raju Questions ED's Affidavit in Supreme Court Hearing

title: 'Narrow thinking of BJP': Shehzad Poonawalla slammed over surname abuse at AAP's Rituraj Jha on TV - The Times of India
summary:
‘Narrow thinking of BJP’: Shehzad Poonawalla slammed over surname abuse at AAP's Rituraj Jha on TV

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In a recent television debate, AAP leader Rituraj Jha faced derogatory comments from BJP member Shehzad Poonawalla regarding his surname. The incident has sparked significant backlash against Poonawalla.

  • Shehzad Poonawalla was criticized for his remarks on Rituraj Jha's surname.
  • The comments were seen as reflective of narrow-mindedness within the BJP.
  • Public reaction has highlighted the importance of respecting individual identities.
“Comments like these only showcase the limited understanding of identity within the BJP,” remarked an AAP spokesperson.

This incident underscores ongoing tensions between political parties regarding identity politics and public discourse.
newTitle: Shehzad Poonawalla Criticizes BJP Over Surname Abuse Incident

Another day, another tragedy: Elderly woman dies at GMC Rajouri; toll 16 - Greater Kashmir
summary:
Tragic Deaths in Rajouri: Elderly Woman Among 16 Fatalities

Date: January 17, Source: Greater Kashmir

An elderly woman has died at GMC Rajouri, bringing the unexplained death toll in Rajouri district to 16.

  • Jatti Begum, 60, from Badhaal village, passed away at GMC Associated Hospital Rajouri.
  • Her husband, Muhammad Yousuf, died two days prior, and five of their children have also succumbed to the same unexplained illness.
  • The J&K Government assures the public that the deaths are not due to communicable diseases.
  • Investigations show no bacterial or viral origin in the disease, with negative tests from major labs.
  • Toxicological analysis detected toxins in biological specimens.
  • A Special Investigation Team (SIT) has been formed by local police to probe the deaths.
  • The Health Minister has been actively engaged in addressing the crisis.
  • Experts from various institutions are involved to determine the cause and ensure public safety.
“The government has been closely monitoring the situation and has taken several steps to find the root cause of the unusual illness.”

Authorities are committed to finding the cause of these tragic events.
newTitle: Tragic Deaths in Rajouri: Elderly Woman Among 16 Fatalities
